Uses of Class
com.studiomediatech.queryresponse.ChainingQueryBuilder

Packages that use ChainingQueryBuilder
Package
Description
com.studiomediatech.queryresponse
The core package in Query/Response for Spring AMQP, providing access to the configuration and builder types that can be used to build Query/Response solutions.

  • Uses of ChainingQueryBuilder in com.studiomediatech.queryresponse

    Methods in com.studiomediatech.queryresponse that return ChainingQueryBuilder
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    ChainingQueryBuilder<T>
    ChainingQueryBuilder.onError(Consumer<Throwable> handler)
    Sets a handler, to receive any errors raised during execution of the query.
    <T> ChainingQueryBuilder<T>
    QueryBuilder.queryFor(String term, Class<T> type)
    Creates a new chaining query-builder for the given term, and the expected type that result elements will be mapped to.
    ChainingQueryBuilder<T>
    ChainingQueryBuilder.takingAtLeast(int atLeast)
    Sets the required amount of result elements for the query.
    ChainingQueryBuilder<T>
    ChainingQueryBuilder.takingAtMost(int atMost)
    Sets the maximum number of elements to consume from responses, effectively limiting the returned results.
    ChainingQueryBuilder<T>
    ChainingQueryBuilder.waitingFor(long millis)
    Set the approximate duration, in milliseconds, that the query will block for when being executed.
    ChainingQueryBuilder<T>
    ChainingQueryBuilder.waitingFor(long amount, TemporalUnit timeUnit)
    Set the duration and temporal unit, to block for when issuing a query.
    ChainingQueryBuilder<T>
    ChainingQueryBuilder.waitingFor(Duration duration)
    Set the duration to block for when issuing a query.
    protected ChainingQueryBuilder<T>
    ChainingQueryBuilder.withSink(Consumer<ChainingQueryBuilder<T>> sink)
    Replaces the current sink for this builder, effectively removing the registry and instead making the terminal operation apply this builder on the provided consumer.
